most_active_tickets.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues

common_issues.title: PiecesOS Startup Failure and Cloud Service Issues
common_issues.description: Users report PiecesOS failing to start, often stuck on "ensuring core dependencies." This might be linked to older processors, specific OS versions (Atlas OS), or cloud service connectivity problems. Solutions include updating to the latest version, reinstalling the app, checking internet connection, and contacting support with logs.

related_issues.title: Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
related_issues.text:
Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.1.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Title:** Pieces for Developers Not Working – Cloud Service & Local LLM Issues  

**Description:**  
Hello Pieces team,  

I have been using *Pieces for Developers* for the past 1.5 months and have been very impressed with its functionality. However, for the last 2–3 weeks, the application has stopped working. Whenever I enter a prompt, I receive the following message:  

> *"I'm sorry, we're having trouble reaching our cloud services. This is likely due to an issue with your local network, such as limited connectivity. Try checking your internet connection or switching your network, then try again. If that doesn't work, please contact support."*  

I have verified my internet connection and tried switching networks, but the issue persists. Additionally, when I attempted to use a local LLM (Ollama) and different LLM aswell, I encountered the same error message, indicating that the problem is not limited to cloud services.  

I would appreciate any guidance on how to resolve this issue. If a fix is not available, I may need to uninstall the application. I have attached relevant screenshots for reference.  

**System Information:**  
- Operating System: Windows 11
- Pieces OS Version: v11.1.2
- Pieces for Developer Version: v3.3.7 
- Network Status: Stable / Switched Networks  

**Steps to Reproduce:**  
1. Open *Pieces for Developers*.  
2. Enter a prompt.  
3. Observe the error message regarding cloud service connectivity.  
4. Attempt to use a local LLM (Ollama) and receive the same message.  

**Expected Behavior:**  
The application should process prompts as expected, either via cloud services or local LLMs.  

**Attachments:**  
[Attach screenshots here] 

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/157e569c-042f-4833-aa67-2bbd2f657f1d)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/25fdf544-8465-45c2-a906-1e492d6533e4)
 

Looking forward to your assistance. Thanks!
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Issue:** User (@rohanrathi99) is experiencing problems with PiecesOS, including:

* Difficulty making requests to Pieces cloud services
* Issues with local models

**Key Points:**

* User provided screenshots as evidence of the problems.
* Pieces support bot identified potentially relevant issues and helpful resources.
* Pieces support agent (@mark-at-pieces) requested logs for further investigation and offered real-time debugging assistance.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Review related issues for potential solutions.
* Check documentation and YouTube resources for additional help.
* Share logs with Pieces support team for analysis.
* Schedule a real-time debugging session with Pieces support agent.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User has been contacted by Pieces support and provided instructions for further troubleshooting.
* The issue is currently under investigation.

**Notes:**

* User's name has been anonymized in this summary.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS takes a while to boot-up(cannot run): (Unable to make it past ensure core dependency in the Desktop application)
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.5

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I got a popup that there was a new version of Pieces OS and that I needed to click and restart to update. But now the desktop app won't start anymore, being stuck on the core dependencies.

I can click on the link, but nothing changes when I do that.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/716af38b-6a71-4162-80f8-b9e9e44f7059)
## Summary:

This GitHub issue conversation details the troubleshooting of a recurring issue with PiecesOS, starting with a complaint about slow boot-up times and inability to run.

**Key Points Raised:**

- Initial complaints: slow boot-up times, stuck on "ensure core dependencies" step, unable to run.
- Solutions attempted:
    - Update to version 11.1.1.
    - Uninstall and reinstall.
    - Investigate for older processors (2015 or older).
    - Investigate potential issues with Atlas OS on Windows.
    - Investigate user logs and potential issues with OneDrive.
    - Update to version 11.1.2.
    - Restart the app.
- Current Status:
    - Some users (Shamas-Habib, JasonDWilson) reported resolution after updating to 11.1.1 and 11.1.2, respectively.
    - rogierlegit initially reported improvement but still experiencing problems.
    - rogierlegit's problem temporarily resolved by restarting the app.

**Problems Identified:**

- Several users experienced issues with the app not starting properly.
- The app may hang on the "ensure core dependencies" step.
- Issues may be associated with older processors, Atlas OS, and OneDrive.
- On MacOS, restarting the app may be necessary to resolve hanging issues.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

- Update to version 11.1.1 or 11.1.2.
- Uninstall and reinstall the app.
- Investigate for older processors (2015 or older).
- Investigate potential issues with Atlas OS on Windows.
- Investigate user logs and potential issues with OneDrive.
- Restart the app.

**Outcomes:**

- Some users reported resolution.
- rogierlegit's problem temporarily resolved.
- Further investigation and development of future patches is ongoing.

## Additional notes:

- This issue has been ongoing for several days.
- The Pieces team is actively working on resolving the issues.
- Communication between the Pieces team and users appears to be ongoing.

recommendations: Investigate and address the PiecesOS startup failure issue, particularly the "ensuring core dependencies" hang.
Improve cloud service stability and connectivity to prevent disruptions in Pieces for Developers.
Provide clearer guidance or troubleshooting steps for users experiencing cloud service or local LLM connectivity issues.
Consider compatibility testing and optimization for older processors and specific OS versions like Atlas OS.
Review and address potential conflicts with OneDrive that might be affecting PiecesOS startup.
